intro: Scabiosa angulata, commonly known as the angular scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Scabiosa angulata is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
